intro: Trichelostylis aspera, commonly known as the rough-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Trichelostylis aspera is adapted to arid conditions and is generally drought-tolerant.
